quest.name: Build on the Stone
journal: Minfilia has a final favor to ask of you.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to Minfilia at the Waking Sands.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.

By curious coincidence, Minfilia contacts you via linkpearl immediately after you deliver the journal to Urianger. She has departed for Revenant's Toll, and bids you follow as soon as you are able. Travel to Mor Dhona, and speak with Tataru inside the Seventh Heaven to gain entrance to the Rising Stones.

Tataru welcomes you as warmly as always, and assures you that the Scions' new headquarters will more than meet with your expectations. Take a moment to explore the Rising Stones, and speak with Minfilia when you are satisfied that you know your way around.

Even as the Scions of the Seventh Dawn celebrate the inauguration of their new headquarters, Urianger arrives unannounced, bearing troubling news. The distant yet dependable Students of Baldesion are no longer responding to his messages. Fearing the worst, Minfilia bids Urianger do everything he can to determine the cause of their uncharacteristic silence. For the time being, however, the Scions have no choice but to continue their work without the aid of one of their closest allies.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Let us set aside the matter of this Ascian until after we have completed our move to the Rising Stones. There is but one final favor I would ask of you before I depart.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I believe I mentioned before that my father was a member of the Ala Mhigan Resistance. The truth, however, is more complicated than that.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: As far as the Empire knew, he was their spy. He maintained the deception for nigh on half a decade, furnishing the Resistance with vital imperial secrets while feeding his paymasters subtly conceived misinformation.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: When he died some fifteen years ago, my father left behind his journal, which I have closely guarded ever since. It contains every shred of information he and his agents could steal on what they believed to be the single greatest threat to Eorzea: the primals.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Its wisdom has guided me through the years, though there is much within I still do not understand...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It is my hope that Urianger will fare better.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Tell him to treat it with care. It is all I have left of my father.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Please, before I reconsider, give my father's journal to Urianger.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I thought thee departed. To what end dost thou linger?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The father's final bequest...the daughter's lifelong labor.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: It is no small thing to surrender such a cherished memento. Well can I imagine the Antecedent's pain. Upon mine honor, I swear to spare no effort in the study of these materials, lest my lady's sacrifice be in vain.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Forename, this is Minfilia.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but I could wait no longer─I have departed for the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: If...if you have yet to...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Once you have given the journal to Urianger, I bid you come to the Seventh Heaven in Revenant's Toll. Tataru will be there to show you inside our new headquarters.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Assuming you have already attuned to it, you may wish to make use of our new aetheryte in Revenant's Toll. After all, it is right on our doorstep!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou hast been summoned to the Rising Stones, yes? Then keep not thy fellows waiting.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Welcome, Forename! Welcome! This is your first time here, if I'm not mistaken?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I think you're going to like our new home! ...Well, what are you waiting for? Go in and have a look!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You're the last to arrive; everyone else is already here.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Why are you standing around here talking to me? They're waiting for you inside!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Well, it is certainly spacious.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Today marks a new beginning for the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, for today we declare our independence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We shall henceforth be beholden to no nation, but serve all of Eorzea's people, proudly and openly.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But this does not mean that we will sever our ties to the Eorzean Alliance. On the contrary, the Antecedent and I shall endeavor to strengthen them. Rest assured, however, that we shall not permit political considerations to influence our decisions.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Our identity remains unchanged, as does our cause. We are the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, and our single purpose is to safeguard the future of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ALL
dialogue.text: (-Scions of the Seventh Dawn-)For Eorzea!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: A moment of your time, Forename. I would speak of Elidibus─

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pardon the intrusion, my lady, but the matter which bringeth me will admit no delay. Mine every attempt to contact the Students of Baldesion hath been met with silence.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: No one will respond?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: How odd. Allow me to try.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...No response. Surely they would not ignore us?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: They have never yet, my lady. I fear we must assume the worst.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: No. No, I will not believe it. An outpost, perhaps, but not their headquarters.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Their wards are beyond circumvention. Had they come under attack, they would most certainly have raised the alarm. None could penetrate their sanctum unnoticed─

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: But for those who lack the gift and the knowledge both. Oh no...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Contact their agents in the field at once. If aught has befallen the Students of Baldesion, they may know of it.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Though the thought of it pains me, until such time as we have evidence to the contrary, we can but assume the worst. Accordingly, we must needs seek another source of information on Elidibus.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis possible that others in the homeland are possessed of such knowledge. Be fairly warned, however: they are unlike to yield it unconditionally.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Do what you must.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet another unforeseen and unwelcome development...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: What could be next, I wonder? A visit from a crimson-clad Ascian, perhaps? Or ocher? Or puce? And which of our allies will then fall silent...?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...For a time, I thought we had gained the upper hand.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: When you shattered the Crystal of Darkness and cast out Lahabrea, I dared to hope that we had found a way to rid ourselves of the Ascian menace.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: But I was wrong. He endures, and may yet return. Upon that point, I have no doubt that Elidibus spoke true.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet there must be a way to destroy them utterly─a way to spare this world their unholy machinations!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I dare not consider the alternative...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: There are forces at work we do not understand, Forename.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I discern them all around─in disturbances too great and too numerous to be dismissed as mere coincidence. Doubtless the Paragons are involved, but how and to what end is far from clear.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I know not what will come, but I do know that we will rise and meet it as one.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ah, my stalwart hero... Your face is a picture of resolve.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I know that you will be ready when the time comes. With luck, however, that will not be for a while yet. Pray return to your private affairs with my blessing. Should anything arise, you will be informed.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Krile...where are you?

dialogue.name: NABRIALESEORZEA
dialogue.text: Your intercession was not foretold.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)You object?

dialogue.name: NABRIALESEORZEA
dialogue.text: We question. Our plans are in motion, your intentions unclear.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)They survived the Seventh Ardor and are stronger now in the gift. Does that not intrigue you?

dialogue.name: NABRIALESEORZEA
dialogue.text: ...No, it does not.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)Serve as you will. So too shall I. We labor not at cross purposes.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)The wisdom of His plan shall become apparent in time, when the veil is lifted from their eyes...

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: (-Elidibus-)And, at long last, they see.
